column4: if I have a hard drive with XP on it, can I install Dapper and have it create a dual boot?
bur[n] er_: does Dapper keep XP and install itself automatically?
of course you can... the new installer was designed with that in mind
you have to repartition your free space to make a new area for ubuntu
bur[n] er_: so its safe to install and not have XP deleted?  do I need to tell Dapper to keep XP??
the wizard walks you through it ;)
bur[n] er_: how do I repartion it without losing XP?
you'll get to a step where it says "wipe out drive completely" or "resize current OS to make room for ubuntu" and you want the latter
just try the wizard ;)  you'll get it
bur[n] er_: as long as I dont lose XP
no worries, it'll be in a nice new boot menu when you start the computer
bur[n] er_: do I have to tell it hda2 etc and create a swap drive?  or it does it for me automatically?
it's pretty intuitive and will do it
